result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Travis Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine $379.00   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Restitution/Surcharges $1873.03 Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
DNA Surcharge $200.00   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad Travis Martin in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:15 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites plea agreement - defendant will post resitution and plead to battery w/o domestic abuse count 2 DRI - $579.00 plus costs.  Atty Duffy states restitution has been paid to Clerk of Court and tendered receipt to the DA in the amount of $1596.61.  Court grants motion to amend ct 1 to delete enhancer.  Plea of NC entered to count 1 as amended.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Court finds defendant guilty.  940.19(1).  DA makes stmt argues sentencing 30 days before paying out restitution to verify who the restitution gets tendered to.  Atty Duffy makes arguement.

COURT:  Fine $579.00 with costs and resitution has been paid $1596.61 (restiution to be held for 30 days for the DA to verify who is to receive the monies DA to notify COC where to forward restitution to)  - given 60 dtp.
   Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Chad Travis Martin in court with attorney TW Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Duffy just received case.  Reset.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

No abusive Contact with  -  Melody Rocaverte
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "   Melody Rocaverte  " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
